headline.main: What Germany's Soldiers Thought of World War I; WAR AND THE GERMAN MIND. The Testimony of Men of Fiction Who Fought at the Front. By Wm. K. Pfeiler. With a Foreword by George N. Shuster. 349 pp. New York: Columbia University Press. $3.25.

lead_paragraph: MODERN war has raised many questions, of which the mental attitude toward war may after all be the most important. The history of this warfare, now that whole populations are involved, transcends more than ever the records of the War Office.
abstract: Pfeiler, Wm K; War and the German Mind
snippet: MODERN war has raised many questions, of which the mental attitude toward war may after all be the most important. The history of this warfare, now that whole populations are involved, transcends more than ever the records of the War Office....
